column3: Interesting; we should definitely do that. Can you move the logic for pruning setBlockIndexCandidates to a separate function (as the same code appears in ActivateBestChainStep)>\n
Aside from whitespace bugs, tested ACK only commithash ba5bf8f6ae344bf2e69ff551490b4262e3e9d129: http://bitcoin.ninja/TheBlueMatt-5194.txt\n
Removed the trailing whitespace on 2867 and 2869, as suggested.\n
Nit: Please remove the trailing whitespace here and on 2869\n

Please check for end before dereferencing *it:

```
    while (it != setBlockIndexCandidates.end() && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(*it, chainActive.Tip())) {
```
It's just moved code, and shouldn't be necessary (see the assert that used to follow...). But this shouldn't hurt.\n
Well I prefer to be of the safe side. Wouldn't want to walk out of the set in case of a bug. But an assertion is fine with me too.\n
No, I agree it feels safer to have the condition. Without it, we wouldn't even reach the assertion before executing code with undefined behaviour (assuming the assertion wouldn't hold).\n
